title.narrative: Project Preparation Facility in the Energy Sector

description.narrative:
Avsikten med insatsen är att underlätta för utvecklingen av energisektorn i Moçambique genom att tillgängliggöra medel för strategiska studier som syftar till att främja förbättringar och utveckling av elsystemet och förvaltning av sektorn och därigenom på medellång till lång sikt möjliggöra förbättrad tillgång till förnybart producerad el för landets befolkning. Huvuddelen av studierna kommer att bestå av genomförbarhetsstudier för ny elproduktion, transmission och energieffektivisering, bedömningar med avseende på socioekonomi, gender och miljökonsekvenser samt studier relaterade till kapacitetsuppbyggnad. För genomförandet av studierna ansvarar det nationella elbolaget EDM på uppdrag av Moçambique. Val av studierna är baserat på ett antal kriterier och EDM ansöker separat för varje studie om att få använda medel. Sverige skall godkänna (eller avslå) ansökningarna och EDM upphandlar därefter konsulter för genomförandet av respektive studie. EDMs upphandlingsförfarande av konsultinsatser för att utföra studierna är baserat på ett ”no objection to” från Sverige i olika skeden av upphandlingsprocessen i enlighet med Sidas upphandlingsregler (Sida Procurement Guidelines, SPG). För att ytterligare öka fokus på hållbarhetsaspekter kommer kravställningen vad avser hållbarhetskriterier för upphandling av konsultinsatserna att ses över och förstärkas.
I syfte att facilitera implementeringen och följa upp aktiviteterna, avser ambassaden handla upp en extern konsult.
Genomförandet av insatsen planeras för perioden 2017-2021, med en total finansiering från Sida om 52 500 000 kr.

The aim of the intervention is to finance a number of studies in the energy sector of Mozambique to enable a continued expansion of electricity generated from renewable energy sources, and the development of the energy system at large. Studies are also planned within the area of energy efficiency, and for Environment and Social Impact Assessments (ESIAs) with an additional focus on gender. The intervention is set for 2017-2021, with at total budget of 52.5 MSEK. The implementing organisation is the state utility of Mozambique (EDM).

description.narrative: The Tender Dossiers for all five packages had been given ‘no objection’ from the Embassy. All five tenders were advertised on 20 and 21 May 2019, with the same submission deadline for all on 2 July 2019. this was later postponed to 2nd of August. three of the tenders had to be cancelled due to SPG issues and now planned to be relaunched by mid- september 2019. General project status is as follow: Project Status As at mid-June 2019, the PPF project status is as follows: PPF Project StatusTsate ESIA/RAP -Negotiation completed with 2nd ranked firm. Contract initialled by both parties on 9 May 2019. Embassy no objection to draft contract submitted to EDM on 20 May 2019. Mavuzi II ; Bundled transmission line studies; Bundled distribution network studies; Energy Efficiency (LED) PIS Hydro + PV - The Invitation to Tender for the PPF projects was published on 20 May 2019 on EDM’s web-site, in local newspapers on 21 and 22 May 2019 and on Sida’s website (Kommersannons) on 21 May 2019. A decision was taken on 14 June to extend the original submission deadline on 2 July 2019 to 17 July 2019 and later to 2nd of August. The EE Study on Time-of-Use and Reactive Power Compensation is still on hold. The first draft ToR for the recommended study to do preliminary route design from Tsate, ESIA screening and ToR for full ESIA and RAP for the selected route was submitted by EDM to the Monitoring Team for review on 16 May 2019. General comments to this draft were submitted to EDM on 22 May 2019. A second, revised draft was provided by EDM on 11 June 2019, and monitoring team comments sent to EDM on 18 June 2019. 4.3 Procurement Process Management of the PPF procurements has been split between different teams within EDM that will be responsible for the respective evaluations. A general list of firms that have indicated interest to submit tenders has been prepared, but the follow-up of requests for clarifications and submission of clarifications has been difficult as responsibilities are scatted and management uneven. In general, clarifications have been submitted late, and several are still outstanding. Although EDM has posted the extended tender submission period on its web-site, it is also important that all firms that have indicated interest to tender receive this new information by e-mail. It is not clear if this is the case for all firms. 5. TENDER EVALUATION PREPARATIONS During the monitoring mission, individual tender evaluation report templates were prepared, including general information and relevant evaluation criteria. It is expected that the use of these templates will facilitate structured evaluation work and enable a standardised assessment of the evaluation process. Several of the EDM staff involved in the PPF projects have no or limited experience of procurement, and many have no knowledge of the Sida Procurement Guidelines (SPG) that apply to the PPF procurements. On request by EDM, a training session on SPG and procurement of consulting services was held on 14 June 2019 for the following staff: Ines Teixeira Apolo FumbujaAnelsio RivisseCirio MuarapazIvo Jossias Firmino Juma All participants were provided with soft copies of a Tender Evaluation Manual, customised for EDM, including templates for both formal documents and working documents to facilitate the evaluation work. Three copies of the manual have also been printed by EDM to be shared between departments. The PowerPoint presentation from the session was also sent to all. There was a lot of interest in the process and many questions were raised, not least in the legal field. The fact that the SPG has not been updated for the past 15 years and contains a number of ambiguities poses a challenge, and was met with some surprise.
